Claim: WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, in Ecuador.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: WHO confirmed 50 new cases in Guayaquil, in Ecuador.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/
ann23_remarks: this could equally be public authority

Claim: A member of Tablighi Jamaat is roaming naked and misbehaving with hospital staff.
Explaination: This claim is completely false and the incident actually happened in August 2019 in Karachi. It has nothing to do with Tablighi Jamaatis or the current outbreak of the novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A member of Tablighi Jamaat is roaming naked and misbehaving with hospital staff.

Explanation:This claim is completely false and the incident actually happened in August 2019 in Karachi. It has nothing to do with Tablighi Jamaatis or the current outbreak of the novel coronavirus.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/old-video-from-pakistan-shared-to-claim-tablighi-jamaat-man-roaming-naked-fact-check
ann23_remarks: doesn't really seem to fit any other category

Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.
Explaination: Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife who is suffering from COVID-19.

Explanation:Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-this-covid-19-patient-is-not-the-wife-of-canadian-pm-justin-trudeau-1658145-2020-03-21

Claim: Anti-malaria drug Chloroquine is a definitive cure for COVID-19.
Explaination: A study found the molecule showed 'apparent efficacy' in treating the disease, trials are still ongoing.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Anti-malaria drug Chloroquine is a definitive cure for COVID-19.

Explanation:A study found the molecule showed 'apparent efficacy' in treating the disease, trials are still ongoing.

https://factcheck.afp.com/chloroquine-has-not-been-approved-treatment-covid-19

Claim: Dr. Naresh Trehan has said that the Indian government is going to declare a national emergency.
Explaination: This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Dr. Naresh Trehan has said that the Indian government is going to declare a national emergency.

Explanation:This is a hoax. Dr Trehan's office has not issued any such message.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-dr-trehan-did-not-say-indian-govt-will-declare-national-emergency-1658838-2020-03-23

Claim: A “poll finds 38% of Americans say they will not drink Corona beer because of the virus.”
Explaination: The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A “poll finds 38% of Americans say they will not drink Corona beer because of the virus.”

Explanation:The poll was conducted by a PR firm. The firm did not release full details about the poll.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/02/facebook-posts/no-poll-does-not-say-38-americans-wont-drink-coron/
ann23_remarks: doesn't really fit any category in my opinion

Claim: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police teams to arrest this coronavirus victim.
Explaination: Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: China needs coronavirus SWAT (special weapons and tactics) police teams to arrest this coronavirus victim.

Explanation:Video shows a mock drill by Tongbai police practicing to take down coronavirus infected patients in case they are uncooperative.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/02/25/chinese-police-forcefully-detaining-coronavirus-patients-on-the-highway/

Claim: Upon approval from Supreme People’s Court, China will kill 20,000 patients with novel coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no such case being tried at the Supreme People’s Court of China. The high court’s record of scheduled hearings on its official website does not show that it was set to decide on such a case on Feb. 7, and neither is there a record of it on the resolved cases tab and press releases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Upon approval from Supreme People’s Court, China will kill 20,000 patients with novel coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no such case being tried at the Supreme People’s Court of China. The high court’s record of scheduled hearings on its official website does not show that it was set to decide on such a case on Feb. 7, and neither is there a record of it on the resolved cases tab and press releases.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-report-claiming-china-kill-20k-covid-1

Claim: An infographic has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a nine-day timeline of the symptoms of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: An infographic has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claim it shows a nine-day timeline of the symptoms of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:This infographic is misleading; it was not distributed by an official health authority and health experts say COVID-19 symptoms vary in duration and severity.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-refute-misleading-timeline-covid-19-symptoms

Claim: The Taiwanese flag is printed on masks to prevent the Chinese from buying them.
Explaination: Production of the mask with the national flag started at the latest in 2019. There is no relationship with this coronavirus. Posts posted as "jokes" on Taiwanese Internet bulletin boards have spread.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Taiwanese flag is printed on masks to prevent the Chinese from buying them.

Explanation:Production of the mask with the national flag started at the latest in 2019. There is no relationship with this coronavirus. Posts posted as "jokes" on Taiwanese Internet bulletin boards have spread.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china-4

Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”
Explaination: Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The health insurance industry has “agreed to waive all co-payments for coronavirus treatments.”

Explanation:Health insurance companies said they will waive costs for coronavirus tests, not treatment. A shortage in diagnostic supplies means that testing is limited.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/12/donald-trump/trump-wrongly-said-health-insurance-companies-will/

Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”
Explaination: MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”

Explanation:MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/facebook-posts/no-msnbc-didnt-say-it-hopes-coronavirus-kills-enou/

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube which claim it shows Chinese police arresting people infected with the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video shows police arresting pro-democracy protesters at a subway station in Hong Kong in August 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-police-officers-arresting-protesters-hong-kong-august-2019

Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.
Explaination: Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.

Explanation:Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-was-this-major-accident-averted-due-to-lockdown-in-delhi-1-1175380.html

Claim: Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.
Explaination: Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Vaccines to cure COVID-19 are ready.

Explanation:Viral image is of a COVID-19 testing kit. A cure is still being researched.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/covid-19-testing-kit-fact-check-coronavirus-1658750-2020-03-23

Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.
Explaination: Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.
Label: False
ann03_remarks: could be social alarm and also conspiracy vs vaccines
html:
Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.

Explanation:Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-countries-with-high-rates-of-childhood-vaccinations-are-not-hardest-hit-with-coronavirus.html
ann23_remarks: I'm assuming "people with/without childhood vaccines" are communities in some sense. One could interpret the vaccine category as relevant, but I think that category is about vaccines for coronavirus specifically

Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times recommend various practices to prevent COVID-19, including gargling salt water, drinking tea and avoiding ice cream.
Explaination: Health experts told AFP there is no evidence to support these claims and say washing your hands regularly is the best way to stay healthy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times recommend various practices to prevent COVID-19, including gargling salt water, drinking tea and avoiding ice cream.

Explanation:Health experts told AFP there is no evidence to support these claims and say washing your hands regularly is the best way to stay healthy.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-authorities-warn-false-covid-19-prevention-tips-online

Claim: Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo says bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://factcheck.afp.com/graphic-purported-quote-philippine-vice-president-leni-robredo-has-been-doctored?check=1

Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.
Explaination: The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.

Explanation:The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-dr-naresh-trehan-coronavirus-covid-19-social-media-viral-post-1-1176172.html

Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
Explaination: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

Explanation:The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

https://factcheck.afp.com/meme-does-not-show-fully-stocked-shelves-during-swine-flu-pandemic
ann23_remarks: it could be about public preparedness, but it's not obvious that it's trying to encourage people to hoard etc.

Claim: Queen Elizabeth said Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte “is the kind of leader who knows the way … Filipinos are very lucky to have him.”
Explaination: Queen Elizabeth delivered a speech addressing the coronavirus on April 5, but she didn't mention President Rodrigo Duterte.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Queen Elizabeth said Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte “is the kind of leader who knows the way … Filipinos are very lucky to have him.”

Explanation:Queen Elizabeth delivered a speech addressing the coronavirus on April 5, but she didn't mention President Rodrigo Duterte.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/viral-image/no-queen-elizabeth-didnt-praise-philippine-preside/

Claim: 3,000 Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: False
html:
Claim: 3,000 Ecuadorians are infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?check=25

Claim: Scientists claim the Wuhan coronavirus is an HIV-1 engineered “super weapon.”
Explaination: The scientific research cited was not peer-reviewed, and the paper was withdrawn by the researchers to revise their results.There was also a note saying it was only a preliminary study.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Scientists claim the Wuhan coronavirus is an HIV-1 engineered “super weapon.”

Explanation:The scientific research cited was not peer-reviewed, and the paper was withdrawn by the researchers to revise their results.There was also a note saying it was only a preliminary study.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471581-fake-news-scientists-did-not-claim-wuhan-coronavirus-is-hiv-1-engineered-superweapon.html

Claim: India has decided to extend its financial year to July 1 due to the current COVID-19 outbreak.
Explaination: The Income Tax department tweeted that the financial year has not been extended and that this gazette was for the collection of stamp duty on security market instruments through stock exchanges and clearing corporations.
Label: False
html:
Claim: India has decided to extend its financial year to July 1 due to the current COVID-19 outbreak.

Explanation:The Income Tax department tweeted that the financial year has not been extended and that this gazette was for the collection of stamp duty on security market instruments through stock exchanges and clearing corporations.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/indias-financial-year-has-not-been-extended-to-july-1-7466

Claim: A train carrying vaccines with the inscription “COVID-19.”
Explaination: Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A train carrying vaccines with the inscription “COVID-19.”

Explanation:Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200318-train-stocke-vaccin-covid-19-attention-intox-coronavirus

Claim: Pigs mulled in China are blamed for coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is from the African swine flu outbreak in China in 2018-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pigs mulled in China are blamed for coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is from the African swine flu outbreak in China in 2018-19.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/videos-of-mass-culling-of-pigs-to-stop-swine-fever-falsely-linked-to-coronavirus-6761

Claim: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew, risking the lives of many amid COVID-19
Explaination: The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Image with the narration to claim that a huge number of Muslims were roaming in Beruwala City in Sri Lanka during curfew, risking the lives of many amid COVID-19

Explanation:The image was from a large Muslim procession held in March 2019.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/30/fact-check-a-year-old-image-being-shared-as-recent-from-beruwala/

Claim: A video shows a man spitting inside food packets during the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: The video is old and out of context, the man in the video blew on the plastic bag to open it up..
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a man spitting inside food packets during the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:The video is old and out of context, the man in the video blew on the plastic bag to open it up..

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-muslim-man-spitting-in-food-packet-viral-amidst-coronavirus/

Claim: Industrialist Ratan Tata’s view on economic downfall due to COVID-19.
Explaination: The quote on economical downfall due to COVID-19 is falsely attributed to Ratan Tata.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Industrialist Ratan Tata’s view on economic downfall due to COVID-19.

Explanation:The quote on economical downfall due to COVID-19 is falsely attributed to Ratan Tata.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/11/fact-check-ratan-tatas-view-on-the-economic-downfall-due-to-covid-19/
ann23_remarks: doesn't seem to fit a category

Claim: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.
Explaination: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.

Explanation:We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/18/fact-check-australian-researchers-have-found-that-bananas-can-help-prevent-an-infection-of-covid-19/

Claim: A post says that if you hold your breath you can tell if you are infected with Covid-19 or not.
Explaination: A pulmonologist and member of the National Public Health Commission assured that this exercise doesn’t have any clinical applicability and it’s not safe. You can do the exercise, pass it and be infected with Covid-19.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A post says that if you hold your breath you can tell if you are infected with Covid-19 or not.

Explanation:A pulmonologist and member of the National Public Health Commission assured that this exercise doesn’t have any clinical applicability and it’s not safe. You can do the exercise, pass it and be infected with Covid-19.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/suster-a-respiracao-e-um-teste-que-mostra-se-a-pessoa-esta-infetada-com-coronavirus/
